title: Polynomial Zeros - degree of a polynomial

content.question: <math alttext="Q open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math><math alttext="negative 4"><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math><math alttext="389"><mn>389</mn></math><math alttext="negative 3"><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="139"><mn>139</mn></math><math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="35"><mn>35</mn></math><math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="25"><mn>25</mn></math><math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math><math alttext="125"><mn>125</mn></math> ​The table gives values of a polynomial function <math alttext="Q"><mi>Q</mi></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>. What is the degree of <math alttext="Q"><mi>Q</mi></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
